contextId.information: The word "us" refers to Paul, the Ephesian church, and all believers in Christ. AT: "God planned long ago to adopt us" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_inclusive]])

The word "we" is includes of all believers. This can be stated in active form. AT: "God chose us as his inheritance" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_inclusive]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: we were chosen as God's inheritance

contextId.information: The word "us" refers to both Paul and the Ephesians, who separated the Jewish believers from the Gentile believers. (See [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_inclusive]])
Here "we both" refers to Paul, the believing Jews, and the believing non-Jews. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_inclusive]])
contextId.quote: For through Jesus we both have access
